Function Documentation

int16_t UDP_ProcessUDPPacket ( void *  IPHeaderInStart,
void *  UDPHeaderInStart,
void *  UDPHeaderOutStart 
)

Processes a UDP packet inside an Ethernet frame, and writes the appropriate response to the output Ethernet frame if a sub-protocol handler has created a response packet.

Parameters:
[in] IPHeaderInStart Pointer to the start of the incoming packet's IP header
[in] UDPHeaderInStart Pointer to the start of the incoming packet's UDP header
[out] UDPHeaderOutStart Pointer to the start of the outgoing packet's UDP header
Returns:
The number of bytes written to the out Ethernet frame if any, NO_RESPONSE otherwise
